means: 激怒，触怒( exasperate的现在分词 )

sentence.Network_en: To see my body literally wither away before my eyes was exasperating.
sentence.Network_cn: 眼见自己的身体日渐衰弱真是让人心烦。

sentence.Network_en: Hardie could be exasperating to his colleagues.
sentence.Network_cn: 哈迪有时让他的同事非常恼火。

sentence.Network_en: She really is the most exasperating woman.

list.abs: To rouse to exasperation or anger ; provoke ., 使恼火 ; 激怒激起愤怒或恼怒 ; 煽动.
It showed the trend with the exasperate terms of trade of the developing country ., 它说明了发展中国家的贸易条件恶化的趋势.
This is an exasperating problem ., 这是一个棘手的难题.

because this is when arrangement ward , if arrive carelessly the mood of this kind of patient , can make an illness exasperate instead , the time of defer heal .因此在安排病房时，假如不注重到这种病人的心情，反而会使病情恶化，延迟痊愈的时间。

entry.def: If you describe someone or something as exasperating, you mean that you feel angry or frustrated by them or by what they do.

example.ex: Hardie could be exasperating to his colleagues...
example.tran: 哈迪有时让他的同事非常恼火。

example.ex: She really is the most exasperating woman.

sentences.sentence: "his cavelier curtness of manner was exasperating"
"the ceaseless tumult of the jukebox was maddening"

auth_sentence.content: Even with those assurances, Ms. Beck said she found the experience exasperating.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: Even with those assurances, Ms. Beck said she found the experience exasperating.

auth_sentence.content: On a purely personal level I find debates with scientist and religious bodies exasperating.
auth_sentence.res_content: On a purely personal level I find debates with scientist and religious bodies exasperating.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: On a purely personal level I find debates with scientist and religious bodies exasperating.

sentences.en: Our team’s failure is very exasperating.
sentences.cn: 我们队失败了，真是气死人。
